record.titleName: Old University of Chicago, with Camp Douglas
record.description: [Photographic copy of a drawing] of the Old University of Chicago's campus with Camp Douglas (background). Camp Douglas, one of the most brutal of all Civil War Prisons, stood south of Chicago on land donated by the family of Illinois Senator Stephen A. Douglas. The bodies of an estimated 6,000 prisoners who died in the camp are interned in a trenched grave at Chicago's Oak Woods Cemetery, the largest Confederate gravesite outside the South.]
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
